name: relabel
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to fasten a new piece of paper, cloth, etc. to something in order to give different information about the object it is attached to: We need to re-label the children's clothing before they go back to school. The empty bottles were relabelled and filled with red liquid.
to describe someone or something differently from the way they were or it was described before: He is trying to relabel himself as a kindly benefactor. The government is now trying to relabel its spending as "investment". Related word
label
More examplesFewer examplesAll of the firms in the industry have been ordered to relabel their products.The carton was relabelled with a new sell-by date.It will take the manufacturers over a year to check and relabel their products.
